discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note: here ^ means power.
I use the logic,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":2}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"consider, "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":2}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"                                              9^1   =  9"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":2}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"                                                9^2   = 81"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":2}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"                                                9^3   =  729"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":2}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"                                                9^4   =   6561"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"and so on."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":2}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus for odd power unit digit = 9 and"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":2}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":" for even power unit digit = 1"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence the answer is 9."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Or you can simply use some basic modular arithmetic noting that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1989"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is odd."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned}1989^{1989}=(1990-1)^{1989}\equiv (0-1)^{1989}&\equiv (-1)^{1989}\\&\equiv -1\\&\equiv -1+10\equiv 9\pmod{10}\end{aligned}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

title: 1989, Russian Mathematical Olympiad
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the positive integers "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with exactly "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"12"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" divisors "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1=d_1<d_2<\\cdots<d_{12}=n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" such that the divisor with index "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_4-1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ("},{"type":"text","text":"that is","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_{d_4-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":") is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(d_1+d_2+d_4)d_8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n = d_jd_{13-j}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for any "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1 \le j \le 12"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_{d_4-1} = d_8(d_1+d_2+d_4)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we must have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"8 < d_4-1 \le 12"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and hence "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"9 < d_4 \le 13"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_4=10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_2=2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_3=5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Moreover
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" d_5n \; = \; d_5d_4d_9 \; = \; d_5d_4(d_1+d_2+d_4)d_8 \; = \; d_4(d_1+d_2+d_4)n "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
so that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_5 = d_4(d_1+d_2+d_4) = 130"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". But then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"13"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a divisor of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_4 < 13 < d_5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". This case is impossible."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_4=11"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" then
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" d_5n \; = \; d_5d_3d_{10} \; = \; d_5d_3(d_1+d_2+d_4)d_8 \; = \; d_3(d_1+d_2+d_4)n "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
so that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_5 = d_3(d_1+d_2+d_4)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_2=2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_1+d_2+d_4=14"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" divides "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_3=7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_5=98"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". But then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"49"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" divides "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_4 < 49 < d_5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_2=3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_1+d_2+d_4=15"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" divides "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_3=5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_5=75"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". But then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"25"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" divides "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_4 < 25 <d_5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_2=5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_3=7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_5=119"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". But then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"17"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" divides "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_4 < 17 < d_5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"None of these cases are possible"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_4=12"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2,3,4,6"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are all divisors of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which is impossible."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus we deduce that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_4=13"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n = (d_1+d_2+d_4)d_8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_5 = d_1 + d_2 + d_4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_2=2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_1+d_2+d_4=16"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" divides "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4,8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are also divisors of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". This case is impossible."}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_2=3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_1+d_2+d_4 =17"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" divides "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_2=5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_1+d_2+d_4=19"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" divides "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_2=7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_1+d_2+d_4=21"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" divides "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a divisor of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which is impossible."}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_2=11"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_3=12"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which is impossible."}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"After running through all these cases, there are only six possible values of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", namely "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^2\times13\times17"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":",  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3\times13^2\times17"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":",  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3\times13\times17^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":",  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5^2\times13\times19"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":",  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5\times13^2\times19"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":",  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5\times13\times19^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Checking these cases shows that the correct solution is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^2 \times 13 \times 17 = \boxed{1989}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

replies.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Yes this is faster. By the way I'm suprised that the answer is the year!

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Your key observation is that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" d_k = d_4 + d_2 + d_1 > d_4 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Once we have that, we can slightly shorted your working to "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" n = d_{12} \geq d_{d_4 - 1} = (d_1 + d_2 + d_4)  d_8 \geq d_5 d_8  = d_{12} = n "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence, we must have equality throughout, so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" d_4 - 1 = 12 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            There is a much faster way to see that d"},{"type":"text","text":"4 is 13. 
Since (d","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"1+d"},{"type":"text","text":"2+d","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"4)"},{"type":"text","text":"(d_8)=d_( (d_4)-1) ) we know that (d_1+d_2+d_4) divides n which makes (d_1+d_2+d_4) a divisor. 
So (d_1+d_2+d_4) = d_k for some k. 
Since (d_1+d_2+d_4)>d_4 we know that k is at least 5. 
Also since (d_1+d_2+d_4)","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"(d"},{"type":"text","text":"8)=d","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"( (d"},{"type":"text","text":"4)-1) ), we know that (d","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"1+d"},{"type":"text","text":"2+d","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"4)"},{"type":"text","text":"(d_8) is a divisor of n and so (d_1+d_2+d_4)","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"(d_8) <= n.  "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Though if k>=6 then (d"},{"type":"text","text":"1+d","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"2+d"},{"type":"text","text":"4)*(d","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"8) = (d"},{"type":"text","text":"k)*(d","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"8) > (d"},{"type":"text","text":"5) * (d","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"8) = n which is a contradiction. "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
So k=5 and (d"},{"type":"text","text":"1+d","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"2+d"},{"type":"text","text":"4)*(d","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"8) = (d"},{"type":"text","text":"5) * (d","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"8) = d"},{"type":"text","text":"12 = d","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"( (d"},{"type":"text","text":"4)-1) ) 
So d","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"4 - 1 = 12 which gives d_4 = 13.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

title: 1995 proposal BY Titu
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the least positive integer "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"19n + 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"95n + 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are both integer squares."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"95n + 1 = { x }^{ 2 }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"19n + 1 = { y }^{ 2 }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", for some positive integers "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ x }^{ 2 } - 5{ y }^{ 2 } = -4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which is generalized Pell equation with solutions given by  "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\huge\ \frac { { x }_{ n } \pm  { y }_{ n }\sqrt { 5 }  }{ 2 }  = { \left( \frac { 1\pm \sqrt { 5 }  }{ 2 }  \right)  }^{ n }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":",  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n = 1, 3, 5, ..."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Using the general formula for the Fibonacci sequence  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large\ { \left\{ { F }_{ k } \right\}  }_{ k \ge 0 }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we conclude that  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large\ { y }_{ m } = { F }_{ 2m - 1 }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m = 1, 2, 3,..."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". It suffices to find the first term of  the sequence "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2, 5, 13, 34, 89, 233, 610, 1597, ..."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  whose square is congruent to  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{1} \pmod { 19 }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". This term is  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ F }_{ 17 } = 1597"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so the answer to the problem is  "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large\ n =  \frac { 1 }{ 19 } \left( { { F }_{ 17 } }^{ 2 } - 1 \right)  = \boxed{134232} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            This question is there from the book Mathematical Olympiad Challenges, and the solution is exactly the same..... In the book it is written in short, but I think you should have elaborated.... "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For the Pell's Equation "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2 - 5y^2 = -4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we can divide both sides by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", giving us:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(\frac{x}{2})^2 - 5(\frac{y}{2})^2 = -1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now the method for solving a Pell's equation with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"-1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in RHS, the traditional way is to square both sides, then see, again we get the exact form of the Pell's equation.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

replies.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            The generalised formula is there for the sequences. You can readily in a book of number theory by titu andreescu.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

                                            You can read about the Fibonacci sequence in Wikipedia in detail.
